data.title: March 29, 1999
data.text:
Feeling critical? Tell us how you'd grade these current film releases. Be sure to watch CNN and Entertainment Weekly next Thursday at 10 p.m. ET on CNN to see how your score stacks up against the critics.

A+ A A- B+ B B- C+ C C- D+ D D- F

"EDtv"

Starring: Matthew McConaughey, Jenna Elfman, Woody Harrelson, Ellen DeGeneres, Dennis Hopper

Ron Howard's latest flick, "EDtv," follows the awkward predicaments of a quirky family whose life is going nowhere. Ed, the youngest son and an unambitious video store clerk, is plucked from obscurity when he agrees to have his "life" aired on cable TV 24 hours a day, instantly becoming a blockbuster hit. You decide if we tune in or tune out ...

RELATED STORY:

Review: Tune in, turn on to 'EDtv'

March 25, 1999

A+ A A- B+ B B- C+ C C- D+ D D- F

"Forces of Nature"

Starring: Ben Affleck, Sandra Bullock, Maura Tierney

Ben Affleck embarks on an journey to wed his fianc√©e (Tierney). Everything is under control until an eccentric young woman (Bullock) literally falls into his life ... making atmospheric conditions in this love triangle unstable. Panic sets in as Ben realizes he's attracted to this sexy, impetuous woman -- and the feeling is mutual. Looks like this is some sort of cosmic test for Ben ... do you think he passed?

RELATED STORY:

Review: 'Forces of Nature' a tempest in a teacup

March 18, 1999

A+ A A- B+ B B- C+ C C- D+ D D- F

"True Crime"

Starring: Clint Eastwood, James Woods, Isaiah Washington, Diane Venora, Bernard Hill, Lisa Gay Hamilton, Denis Leary

Steve Everett (Eastwood), a grizzled investigative reporter, risks it all to free a condemned man. A troubled man himself, Everett is chosen to conduct the final interview with a convicted murderer (Washington) on death row. Anticipating a routine story, he reluctantly begins research on the criminal's case. Steve Everett, harried, hassled and trying not to self-destruct, has less than 12 hours to save the life of a man he knows is innocent. What's your verdict?

RELATED STORY:

Reviewer watches 'True Crime' grind to slow death

March 25, 1999

Want to look at the report cards? Watch CNN and Entertainment Weekly this Thursday at 10 p.m. ET and see the results!
